alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Clayton; Fayette; Howard; Winneshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 9:46PM CST until January 15 at 3:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Friday into Friday Night... .A winter storm impacts Minnesota and Iowa Friday and Friday night, with the greatest impacts towards the Interstate 35 corridor. Snow amounts steadily taper off from west to east as one moves towards the Mississippi River. In addition, east to northeast winds gusting up to 30 mph could cause patchy blowing and drifting snow, especially in open areas towards central Minnesota and Iowa. If you have travel planned, monitor for forecast for updates and be prepared for hazardous conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO 3 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Howard, Clayton, Allamakee, Winneshiek and Fayette Counties. * WHEN...From 6 AM Friday to 3 AM CST Saturday. The heaviest snowfall should occur Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute, but mainly the mid-day and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
